meanings.definition: To pull or drag with effort or force.
meanings.sent1: The workers were hauling heavy boxes up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was hauling a cart full of hay to the barn.
meanings.sent3: The children were hauling their toys back to their rooms after playing outside.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was hauling the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the engine echoed through the valley as the truck was hauling lumber.

meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods by vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The hauling of goods by trucks is essential for delivering products to stores.
meanings.sent2: The company specializes in long-distance hauling of furniture.
meanings.sent3: The hauling of groceries from the car to the kitchen can be tiring after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The hauling of supplies to the remote village was a challenging task.
meanings.sent5: The colorful trucks lined up for the hauling competition at the fair.

meanings.definition: The distance over which something is transported.
meanings.sent1: The long hauling of goods from the warehouse to the port was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The short hauling of materials from the backyard to the shed was quick and easy.
meanings.sent3: The kids measured the hauling of their toys from one end of the room to the other.
meanings.sent4: The endless hauling of memories from the past to the present weighed heavily on her mind.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runners faced the challenging hauling of the race course through the city streets.
